title: How many sp,sp2,sp3 hybridized carbon in CH3-C C-CH=CH2? - Quora

response.answer_text: CH3-CC-CH=CH2 is pent-1-en-3-yne. There is an easy way to tell the hybridization of carbon. sp carbon has coordination number 2, i.e. it has two nearest neighbors. sp2 carbon has coordination number 3. sp3 carbon has coordination number 4. (Note: the carbon is tetravalent in each case: the difference comes from forming double and triple bonds to the same neighbor.) So C1 of pent-1-en-3-yne is sp2 hybridized. C2 is sp2 hybridized. C3 is sp hybridized. C4 is sp hybridized. C5 is sp3 hybridized. And that makes 2 sp hybridized, 2 sp2 hybridized, and 1 sp3 hybridized carbon.  Now, to convince yourself that you understand this, answer the question for pent-1-en-4-yne, HCC-CH2-CH=CH2.

Hybrid orbitals …. Assuming you actually need to know this …. Hybrid orbitals were “invented” by Linus Pauling in the early 1930s in order to justify the geometry of (mostly) organic molecules. In order to determine the hybridization, you first need to know the geometry. Electron-pair geometry ….. hybridization …. (molecular geometry)Linear ……………. …………………… sp …………….... (linear)Trigonal planar …………………… sp2 …………..… (trigonal planar, bent)Tetrahedral …………………………. sp3 …………..… (tetrahedral, trigonal pyramidal, bent) …..5 ...4 ..3…2 …..1H3C−C≡C−CH=CH2Carbon ……..hybridization1 ………………. sp22 ………………. sp23 ………………. sp4 ………………. sp5 ………………. sp3
